text: Frank Wilson Jobe (July 16, 1925 â€“ March 6, 2014) was an American orthopedic surgeon and co-founder of the Kerlan-Jobe Orthopaedic Clinic. Jobe invented a kind of elbow operation for baseball players. This surgery is called Tommy John surgery. Jobe died on March 6, 2014 in Santa Monica, California, aged 88. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American physicians Category:People from Greensboro, North Carolina
title: Frank Jobe
